text: <@U38EZFVFE> <@U3T21PDBK> Thanks removing the width has worked.

I have created a blog I named it "Schedule" from content settings and this blog is using custom blog template. I want to print the posts from this blog to my html page template. How can I achieve this?

Does anyone know the accuracy of HubSpot reporting? I am using Shopify connected to HubSpot and Shopify shows sales associated with advertising, but HubSpot shows non. I have everything connected and I am really trying to figure out which is more accurate? I am guessing, if HubSpot doesn't get an email from the customer, It has no idea if the sale was associated with a connected PPC platform? Any help would be wonderful.

Hey guys, do you know if we can not use the default css from HubSpot ?
Mostly the layout part. I'd like to try with another framework
you don´t have to use the default css you can use a different framework

Great. Thanks for the link!
But i'm not sur to see how not load the default CSS. I don't think i load it myself

Hey <@UM4A8EP3M> Those analytics for HubSpot would be driven off the association of the cookie to the contact record, so if HubSpot never saw a contact (aka we don’t have an email address) then it makes sense we HubSpot wouldn’t show any revenue connected to PPC. Happy to help look at any specifics you’d be willing share as well. Thanks for the heads up <@U38EZFVFE>

anyone know if there is an easy way to find your page template that a page is using off of the page comments "start coded_template: id:"  Example client gives you a front end page url and says they need an edit. Any shortcut to finding that page?
if you’re loggedin you should see the HubSpot snippet
and there you have edit page/template and other goodies
THANKS! not sure how I missed that, appreciate the quick reply mate!
